intro: Paraphaius flavus, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its compact growth habit and attractive foliage make it a desirable ornamental plant in dry gardens.
